titlestmt.titleproper: Overview of the Collected Works of Milton Friedman Project records
Collected Works of Milton Friedman Project records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-12-14T13:44-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Collected Works of Milton Friedman Project records
did.abstract: Photocopies of speeches, writings, and correspondence of the American economist Milton Friedman, and recordings of his television appearances. Project sponsored in part by the Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace. Used as research material for The Collected Works of Milton Friedman, compiled and edited by Robert Leeson and Charles G. Palm. Much of the material is available online as part of the Collected Works of Milton Friedman website, http://miltonfriedman.hoover.org.

origination.label: Contributor
origination.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Much of the material is available online at the Collected Works of Milton Friedman website, miltonfriedman.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Collected Works of Milton Friedman Project records, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2016.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collections
relatedmaterial.p: Milton Friedman papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Free to Choose video tape collection, Hoover Institution Archives
The Legacy of Milton and Rose Friedman's Free to Choose conference proceedings, Hoover Institution Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of speeches, writings, and correspondence of the American economist Milton Friedman, and recordings of his television appearances. Used as research material for The Collected Works of Milton Friedman, compiled and edited by Robert Leeson and Charles G. Palm. The purpose of this project was the publication of all of Friedman's writings. It was originally sponsored by Palgrave Macmillan Limited, who planned to publish the materials as a multivolume set. The project was then sponsored by the Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace after Palgrave withdrew. Much of the material has now been published online as part of the Collected Works of Milton Friedman website, http://miltonfriedman.hoover.org.
